The plant has a distinctive appearance with closely spaced, needle-like leaves that form dense, cushion-like growths. It lacks true stems and roots, relying instead on rhizoids for anchorage and nutrient absorption. Phlegmariurus tafaensis plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates in its native ecosystems.
